New Tab Pages

The New Tab Page is the page that appears when the user creates a new tab or window. You can override the default New Tab Page, providing an HTML file to be used instead. This HTML file usually has CSS and JavaScript code, as well as HTML.

[PENDING: Show a screenshot here, featuring both the + and the NTP.]

Manifest

Register your New Tab Page in the extension manifest like this: 

"chrome_url_overrides": {
  "newtab": "newtab.html"
}

Examples

For an example of specifying a very simple New Tab Page, see the override_igoogle example. That example uses a 3-line file named redirect.html to implement the New Tab Page.
